description: Exclusively, in our Orlando Florida  showroom is this beautiful Custom built  1966 Austin Healey 3000 MKIII  Tribute that was built in house by Classic Roadsters LTD  in Fargo North Dakota in 1988 for Ã¢??The Price is Right Ã¢?? tv show. This incredibly well done tribute will provide you with miles of fun and excitement and be the envy of anyone who sees it . The 302 V8 engine is mated to a T-10 4 speed manual transmission with a Ford 8 inch rear end with 3:00 gears. The motor sounds perfect & runs strong. It pulls strong through the whole RPM range. It shifts smoothly through-out all the gears and is ready for miles of fun  !!. The car is painted with Black Gel Coat  and looks sharp. Everything in the interior looks sharp from the Black leather seats to the wood dashboard. The car is loaded with options and features an AM FM  Cassette, Manual Convertible  Top,  Tilt Wheel,  wire wheels and radial tires . The car runs and drives. This car was built to be a driver, not just a trailer queen. Don't miss your chance to take this beautiful classic home. For more information on this 1966 Austin Healey 3000 MKIII Tribute please call us at 407-771-2000 or visit the Orlando Florida Showroom or email us at Orlando@gatewayclassiccars.com. More pictures and an HD video are available at: http://www.gatewayclassiccars.com/orlando/1988/austin-healey/3000-S773.html

description: This 1963 Austin Healey 3000 Mark II BJ7 2 Door Convertible (
Stock # B11293
) is available in our Benicia, CA showroom and any inquiries may be directed to us at
or via email at [Sales@SpecialtySales.com](
mailto:Sales@SpecialtySales.com
Outstanding 1963 Austin Healey 3000 Mark II BJ7 Convertible

The next amazing vehicle up for grabs in our Benicia showroom is this 1963 Austin Healey 3000 Mark II BJ7 2 Door Convertible with blue exterior paint and a matching blue leather interior.  It features a 302 cid V-8 engine under the hood with an Edelbrock gear drive and 4 bbl. carburetor, Keith Black 10.5” pistons, a 2000 stall converter, Magnaflow mufflers and a Ford C-4 transmission.  This amazing classic also had a Ford 9” rear end with 3:50 Posi-traction gears, front disc brakes, 70 Spoke Dayton Wheels, a great sound system and more.
Built for Ride Quality & Blistering Performance

The current owner of this 1963 Austin Healey 3000 Mark II BJ7 Roadster has enjoyed it for many years now and decided that it was worthy of a complete restoration from the ground up.  That included overhauling a 1969 Ford 302 motor for this classic plus adding high end accessories and performance parts throughout.  The build was completed with extensive body work, beautiful fresh paint and a refreshing of the chrome, interior and trim work.

In terms of performance, this 1963 Austin Healey 3000 Mark II BJ7 is lightning fast with a fantastic weight to power ratio.  It does everything well from acceleration to tight cornering, plus it has solid stopping power as well.  There simply is nothing here not to like about this classic if you’re looking for a high-end resto mod.
Must Be Seen in Person to Truly Appreciate

Overall, this 1963 Austin Healey 3000 Mark II BJ7 Roadster is a true joy to drive and the current asking price doesn’t even begin to cover the build costs involved.  This is a steal of a classic for any performance enthusiast and we do not expect for it to remain available for long.  For more information about this vehicle, visit our Benicia, California showroom, give us a call at
, or email us at [Sales@SpecialtySales.com](
mailto:Sales@SpecialtySales.com
).  Be sure to mention
Stock # B11293
as well.

The information for this vehicle was provided by the current owner and it is not certified by Specialty Sales Classics.  Therefore, it is in no way guaranteed as a basis of purchase.  Any statements such as original or numbers-matching should be verified independently by the buyer prior to purchase.
title: 1963 Austin Healey 3000

description: Exclusively, Only in our Houston showroom is this beautiful and fully restored 1964 Austin Healey 3000 BJ8 MKIII that is in near brand new condition.  This incredibly well done restoration was completed by a local mechanic that found the car in a barn while provided a mobile service for a collector client .  The car was originally a California titled car and was brought to Texas in 2008.  It was worked on for several years slowly before the previous owner gave up and let the car sit idle for 6 years. Then the current owner came across it in a barn.  He purchased the car in 2015 in Houston and did a frame off restoration.  They reconditioned & refinished almost every bolt on the car.  For any car collector looking for one for his collection would be lucky to be able to get one that looks the way it does. The 3-liter inline 6 cylinder engine was rebuilt. It received all new bearing & rings,the cam shaft & lifters were replaced, new timing chain was added and all the gaskets and seals were replaced, including all freeze plugs.  The cylinder head got reworked including new style valve stem seals.  The SU carbs were rebuilt and everything was painted correctly. The motor sounds perfect & does not smoke at all.  It pulls strong through the whole RPM range. The owner replaced the solenoid for the electric overdrive and the sycrnos are in good shape. It shifts smoothly through-out all the gears and the overdrive works perfectly. The engine bay was painted black while the chassis and frame were all coated with Por-15, a super heavy duty rust inhibitor thatÃ¢??s been trusted for years. Each panel was sanded down and primed. Then the car was put back together with all the parts in primer and more bodywork was done. Then each panel was painted and the car was finished off. Everything in the interior was replaced except the seats and the console which had already recovered.  Moss Motors supplied a complete kit with door panels and new carpet including the trunk carpet. The car also has brand new chrome wire wheel.  The car runs and drives perfectly and everything works & as it should.  This car was built to be a driver, not just a trailer queen. With that in mind some modifications have been made. It has a modern charging system so the generator and regulator have been replaced by an alternator. It has an aftermarket Pertronics distributor so the points have been eliminated. It also has a modern radio with bluetooth.  It now also has a 12-volt negative ground electrical system.  The restoration took almost a year and was documented along the way. Photos of the project can be provided. Also available is a stack of receipts; which total about 20K in parts alone.   ItÃ¢??s been driven just under 300 miles since it was completed in Dec 2016. The car needs nothing to be complete. Don't miss your chance to take this beautiful classic home. For more information on this 1964 Austin Healey 3000 BJ8 MKIII please call us at 832-243-6220 or visit the Houston Showroom at 71 Esplanade Blvd Suite 100. Houston, TX 77060. More pictures and an HD video are available at http://gatewayclassiccars.com/houston/1964/austin-healey/3000-S618.html.
title: 1964 Austin Healey 3000
